intro: Psilocaulon melanospermum, commonly known as the black-sporing psilocaulon, is a rare and intriguing member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, dark-colored spores that contrast with its slender, erect stems. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Despite its botanical interest, it remains a little-studied species, with limited information on its ecological role and cultivation potential.
